intro: Sabulina austromontana, commonly known as the alpine sedge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. This species is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Sabulina austromontana plays an important role in stabilizing soil in alpine environments and is often found in open, sun-exposed habitats.
